Allentown School District Superintendent says disruptive student behavior will not be tolerated https://t.co/rRn2XZn2wf
@RDHarting Not specifics. In regards to my story - comments made how media just focuses on negative. Mayo did say he believes teachers.
@edwhitemagic yup
.@CeCeGerlachASD tells me she met w/ teachers who told her similar stories that they told me in my @mcall Tuesday
Some start singing, "na na na, na, goodbye" to Armstrong at end of meeting.
Armstrong chimes in: "I'm happy to be relieved of this duty." Then teachers clap.
"We're not doubting what the teachers are saying," Mayo says.
Allentown is not the only place where this is happening, Mayo says.
Mayo also says he's asking principals to swiftly address any aggression shown by students to authority figures.
Mayo says he's asking principals to identify students who they are most concerned about.
Mayo then says he doesn't know where quote came from that he doesn't believe what teachers' claims ...
Mayo now addresses claims by teachers. Says some of the principals did share same stories of teachers.
Armstrong says it's illegal for the district to pay salary of teachers union president when she performs union duty. End of discussion
And now it's time for Armstrong's big news.
"Safety concerns are not a new problem. I have seen the behavior standards slide lower and lower," - another parent says.
Roth tells the board people are intimidated by directors and administration.
"Many of you already know this, but year after year after year after year, nothing is done," Roth tells the board.
Parent David Roth says violence in schools has been happening for 8 years now. "It's nothing new."
Parent does say there is a crisis in the district and something has to happen before others get hurt.
Parent also says she has been very happy with her children's education in the Allentown School District.
Parent of Allen and Trexler students ask that the board create a task force for dealing w/ violence in schools.
Board passes contract for secretaries 7-0. Secretaries union also agrees.
For the record, teachers have told me it's a small number of students who are disruptive. About 10 to 20 percent of students.
Student says he does not like to be "pre-judged." Says not all students are like that.
Dieruff student rep addresses media attention on Dieruff student who allegedly pushed teacher down bleachers.
Smith asks Allen student rep how everything is going for her. "Um, everything is going well," student says.
Bob Smith says teacher who was allegedly pushed down bleachers by Dieruff student is making a good recovery.
I'll get back to the meeting now. I think I made my point.

Allentown board winners look to be incumbents @CeCeGerlachASD, @CharlieThiel, Robert Smith, Elizabeth Martinez and newcomer Audrey Mathison.
Gerlach still about 500 votes ahead of Robert Smith, who is second in votes. https://t.co/9HseaAWanu
.@CharlieThiel has shown up at @CeCeGerlachASD's victory party. Thiel has 17 percent of votes, in third behind Gerlach and Robert Smith.
Armstrong gives me another statement: "It's no secret, the abuse is part of the job when one is a Republican in Allentown."
So, without naming him, incumbents are pleased Scott Armstrong looks to be ousted by Mathison.
Liz Martinez, also poised to win, says she's happy with Mathison getting on the board. Calls this board "on the verge of a revolution."
Lots of hugs going around for @CeCeGerlachASD https://t.co/6SrsEIhDay
Mathison also was prez of Parkland union when teachers went on strike in 2003. Armstrong, meanwhile, has butted heads with ASD teachers.
If Mathison does get on the board, she has a different background than Armstrong. Now retired, she was a Parkland teacher for 40 years.
Armstrong tells me his loss is "truly a win" for him. Says he was insulted when he went to vote today. "Really not worth the abuse," he says
At @CeCeGerlachASD's victory party, supporter shouts: "We got this. We're number one."
(cont.) "So be it, it is the will of the voters. I am fine with that." - Armstrong.
Statement from Armstrong: Clearly the night is not going well for those who wanted me to serve another term. (cont.)
"This will be a totally different board," she says if it is Gerlach, R Smith, Thiel, Martinez and Mathison. Four are incumbents.
At Gerlach's party at Brewworks, she says board just needed one new person, alludes to Armstrong.
.@CeCeGerlachASD has almost 300 votes more than Robert Smith, who is in second place for Allentown School Board.
Interesting that Mark Smith is a registered Democrat but because of cross-filing, ended up on Republican ticket and not on Dem.
Mathison and Martinez are on just Democrat ticket, but lead over Mark Smith and Scott Armstrong on Republican ticket.
Gerlach, R Smith and Thiel are on both R and D tickets and lead in votes.
@sarahcummings78 Right. We wrote a lot about it this year. Here's a story from before the primary about the PAC. https://t.co/AA3AbhpezV
.@CeCeGerlachASD and Robert Smith leading in results now. Sidebar: both of them were left off of @Ed_Pawlowski's PAC.
Incumbent Scott Armstrong and newcomer Mark Smith still trailing the other five candidates. Both have 9 percent with 6 out of 55 precincts
@LehighCourts @emilyopilo Now that's something I'll <3
As more numbers come in, @CeCeGerlachASD moves ahead of others. No surprise. She had most votes on Dem ticket in primary and 2nd most on Rep
W/ 4 of 55 precincts: Gerlach 20 %, R. Smith 17 %, Thiel !7 %, Martinez 15 % Mathison 13 %, M Smith 9 % and Armstrong 9 %.
Two more precincts now in. Armstrong and Mark Smith still last,  but Mark Smith has now moved ahead Armstrong. @CeCeGerlachASD still leads
Incumbent Scott Armstrong trails Audrey Mathison (fifth in lead) by 50 votes in very early numbers. Seven vying for 5 seats.
It's still @CeCeGerlachASD, Robert Smith, @CharlieThiel, Liz Martinez and Audrey Mathison in the lead.
Second precinct #s are in. @CeCeGerlachASD still in the lead. Board president Robert Smith has moved up to second most votes.
.@CeCeGerlachASD and Martinez are close with 68 and 67 votes . Mark Smith currently last in results, but still early.
We have our 1st results for Allentown School Board. CeCe Gerlach, Elizabeth Martinez, Robert Smith, Charlie Thiel & Audrey Mathison leading
